meanings.definition: Partially deaf; having some degree of hearing loss.
meanings.sent1: She is semideaf and wears hearing aids to help her hear better.
meanings.sent2: The semideaf student sat in the front row to hear the teacher clearly.
meanings.sent3: The semideaf puppy barked loudly, thinking it was whispering.
meanings.sent4: His semideaf ears picked up only fragments of the music, like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The semideaf old man enjoyed feeling the vibrations of the music through the floor.

meanings.definition: A person who is partially deaf.
meanings.sent1: The semideaf in the group used sign language to communicate with others.
meanings.sent2: She became a semideaf after a childhood illness affected her hearing.
meanings.sent3: The semideaf at the concert danced joyfully to the vibrations of the music.
meanings.sent4: The semideaf was grateful for closed captions on TV shows.
meanings.sent5: The semideaf artist expressed herself through vibrant colors and textures in her paintings.
